alert.note: Alert for Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT FLAGLER AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. JOHNS COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 1257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Butler Beach, or near Saint Augustine, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Hastings, Saint Augustine Beach, Marineland, Vilano Beach, Crescent Beach, and Saint Augustine Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
